intro: Matelea balbisii, commonly known as the Balbis's mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the flowers range in color from white to pink, often appearing in late spring to early summer. Matelea balbisii is adapted to arid environments and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
